skill.description: Analyze project stack and recommend skills. Auto-detects frameworks, activates generic ai-dev-kit skills, and optionally scaffolds project-specific skills in the target repo.

security_audit.summary: The stack-analyzer skill is a documentation-only meta-skill with no executable code. It performs static analysis by reading project configurations and generating markdown reports with skill recommendations. No security risks identified.

content.user_title: Analyze Your Tech Stack and Get AI Skill Recommendations
content.value_statement: Stop manually configuring AI development skills for each project. Stack-analyzer automatically detects your technology stack and recommends the perfect skills for AI-assisted development.
actual_capabilities: Auto-detects project technologies from files and dependencies
Recommends framework-generic skills from ai-dev-kit plugin
Scaffolds project-specific skills with customizable templates
Generates detailed markdown reports with recommendations
Integrates with library-detection skill for accurate analysis
Creates manifest tracking all generated skills
limitations: Requires library-detection skill for stack analysis
Cannot analyze closed-source or proprietary frameworks
Project-specific skills need manual customization after scaffolding
Generic skills may need tuning for unique project requirements

use_cases.title: Optimize AI Assistant Performance

best_practices: Review recommendations before activation to ensure they match your project needs
Customize scaffolded skills with project-specific patterns and vocabulary
Keep the generated manifest for tracking and cleanup purposes

anti_patterns: Activating all recommended skills without reviewing their purpose
Ignoring the generated manifest and losing track of created skills
Assuming generic skills will work perfectly without any tuning

faq.question: Is stack-analyzer compatible with all project types?
faq.answer: Stack-analyzer works with any project that has detectable files or dependencies. It supports all major languages and frameworks through pattern matching.

faq.question: What are the detection limits?
faq.answer: Detection relies on file patterns and package dependencies. It may miss custom or proprietary frameworks without standard indicators.

faq.question: How does integration with ai-dev-kit work?
faq.answer: Stack-analyzer runs automatically during /ai-dev-kit:setup and can be invoked manually with /ai-dev-kit:recommend-skills command.

faq.question: Is my project data safe during analysis?
faq.answer: Yes, stack-analyzer only reads file names and dependency lists. No source code content is analyzed or transmitted.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot if no skills are recommended?
faq.answer: Check that your project has recognizable files or dependencies. Run library-detection skill separately to verify stack detection.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual skill configuration?
faq.answer: Stack-analyzer automates detection and provides consistent recommendations across projects, saving time and ensuring comprehensive coverage.
